meanings.definition: A small, round green citrus fruit.
meanings.sent1: I love to eat limes with my tacos.
meanings.sent2: The recipe calls for a squeeze of fresh limes.
meanings.sent3: Why did the lemon go to the party with the lime? Because they make a great pair of fruits!
meanings.sent4: Her bright green dress was as vibrant as a basket of limes.
meanings.sent5: The scent of freshly cut limes filled the kitchen with a refreshing aroma.

meanings.definition: A type of tree that produces limes.
meanings.sent1: The limes on the tree were ripe and ready to be picked.
meanings.sent2: The farmer planted a new lime tree in the orchard.
meanings.sent3: Why did the orange tree want to be friends with the lime tree? Because they both liked to branch out!
meanings.sent4: The lime tree stood tall in the garden, bearing fruit like a generous host.
meanings.sent5: The leaves of the lime tree rustled in the breeze, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.sent1: She painted her room in a lovely shade of limes.
meanings.sent2: The artist mixed yellow and green to create a beautiful lime color.
meanings.sent3: Why did the traffic light turn limes instead of red? It wanted to be more refreshing!
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in hues of limes and oranges.
meanings.sent5: The fields were bathed in the soft light of the setting sun, casting a lime glow over everything.

meanings.definition: A hard, white substance used in building.
meanings.sent1: The sculptor carved intricate designs into the limes.
meanings.sent2: The architect chose limes for the elegant pillars of the building.
meanings.sent3: Why did the marble statue want to be friends with the limes? Because they were both rock solid!
meanings.sent4: The palace was adorned with limes that gleamed like polished ivory.
meanings.sent5: The steps of the grand staircase were made of limes, adding a touch of sophistication to the entrance.
